question: In which of the following cases, the Supreme Court ruled that “judicial review” is a “basic feature” of the Constitution and hence, it cannot be amended?
option2: Kesavananda Bharati v. State of Kerala
option3: Minerva Mills Ltd. v. Union Of India
option4: Miss Bindiya Mukhija v. State Of Punjab
answer: Minerva Mills Ltd. v. Union Of India
explanation: In Minerva Mills Ltd. V. Union of India, the Supreme Court ruled that “judicial review” is a “basic feature” of the constitution and hence, it cannot be amended.
